name: The Peninsula Beverly Hills

reviews.text: What an incredible hotel. My wife and I had a wonderful time at the Peninsula in Beverly Hills. We especially enjoyed dinner on their terrace near the pool. The views of the city were outstanding and the service was over the top. We'll definitely go back.
reviews.title: Beautiful!

reviews.text: During a family/ sightseeing trip I stayed 7 nights at the Peninsula/ Beverly Hills. Although this house just won the " best big city hotel US " award, I found the Peninsula a very generic hotel.
reviews.title: Nothing Special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were rather simple and a little worn. The rooms are quite cheaply furnished compared to the Asian Peninsula hotels ( no TVs in the bathrooms, no central control next to bed, used carpeting and not wooden floors) The interior of the rooms does no way qualify for the high prices charged.
reviews.title: Wow!

reviews.text: one can expect more from Peninsula. Reception and consierge were faultless and helpful, not a single item on the bill , that was not justified.
reviews.title: Peninsula delivers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Houskeeping was another story. We had items in our room , that did not belong to us, somtimes showercaps were not restocked..... little things, that should not happen , when paying 780 USD.
reviews.title: Just perfect
Great place
reviews.text: Very very good hotel throughout all categories. Here is a summary:
- general: very good looking tuscan style, very high standards and good spacious lobby areas for meeting up or relaxing
reviews.title: Wow - what more can I say

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - rooms: great. Large, well equipped, large bathrooms, very comfortable beds. Nothing to complain about.
reviews.title: favourite hotel in la

reviews.text: - bar/restaurants: very cozy bar, large english style oak bar with big leather sofas and chairs. Two restaurants, fine dining at belvedere on bottom floor which served good food in a smart set up. More casual and relaxed restaurant on the roof top by the pool. Good for breakfast and lunch.
reviews.title: The best hotel in LA!
GREAT ROOM AND SERVICE
reviews.text: - pool: excellent pool on the roof top, try to get one of the cabanas

I loved the smaller feel of this hotel, service amazing. Will go back. Gorgeous! Loved the intimate hotel bar, restaurant was superb. Staff can't do enough to help you. The hotel car is a handy bonus.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at the Peninsula and had a remarkable time. This was truly a five star experience. A smaller hotel feel, but really amazing service and attention to detail.
reviews.title: An impressive Beverly Hills hotel
Used to be our favorite but not any more...
reviews.text: We checked in early at 10:30 a.m. and the front desk staff graciously had as wait maybe all of 10 minutes while sipping a glass of lemonade. We were escorted to our room by one of the hotel managers. The room was newly refurbished and had everything you can ask for. The room décor is certainly high-end traditional/European (not really my personal taste, but still was lovely, quality furniture). Carpets were perfectly clean and spotless. Tub was gigantic. The beds were extremely comfortable. The duvet was a bit too warm for us, but that's a very minor thing. Soaps and shampoos were nice, and replenished throughout the stay. Lovely chocolates waiting for us to celebrate our anniversary.

reviews.title: The Peninsula is "be plus ultra"of California hotels.
reviews.text: Overall, the service at this hotel is outstanding. The breakfast staff are awesome (Mike) and truly service professionals. We had several items from the breakfast menu, but my favourite was the banana-stuffed french toast. Dinner at the Belvedere was also a highlight of the week.

The hotel bar was a great place to relax for a pre-dinner drink, and again, the staff were exceptional! My favourite drink of the week was called "La Drama". Oh, and the complimentary bar snacks are also fabulous - best olives ever!
reviews.title: My new Los Angeles favorite

reviews.text: Beautiful hotel in Beverly Hills, great rooms and delicious food.
reviews.title: Phenomenal

reviews.text: All the staff is super nice and they will make anything to please their guests.
reviews.title: Family Trip delight

reviews.text: Concierge is superb! They suggested a few restaurants for my short stay and all of them were incredible. Hotel has a complimentary car service (either a Mercedes Benz or a Rolls Royce) and they will take you anywhere in Beverly Hills.
reviews.title: Simply the best

aka: The Peninsula Beverly Hills Hotel Beverly Hills
description: As Los Angeles' most exclusive and elegant hotel, The Peninsula Beverly Hills resembles a gracious private residence built in the classic Renaissance style. The hotel is tucked amid lush gardens in a quiet corner of the city, offering luxurious comfort, sophisticated facilities, a tranquil spa, extraordinary dining and legendary Peninsula service. Our 194 guest rooms, suites and private villas were all elegantly refurbished in 2011, featuring new furniture and upgraded technology. Conveniently located near Beverly Hills' most important business, shopping and entertainment areas, The Peninsula Beverly Hills is the ideal destination for business executives, leisure travelers and families alike. Unique to the hotel is our 24-hour check-in/check-out experience, meaning you may arrive and depart at your leisure.
